page.title: 12BENTWORTH CHURCH
page.content: RELIGION The church of St Mary's,positioned at the north east of the village.It stands in the centre of a churchyard which is enclosed by a wooden panelling and surrounded by tall trees.The nave arcades date from the quarter of the century.The Aisle of the nave seems to have been built in the 14th century. The church has been entirely refaced with dressed flints.The brickwork renewed'and the whole church reroofed. The present tower arch dates from 1890 and the belfry placed on the tower and finished with a short octagonal spire covered with tiles of the same date. by Jonathan & John.
